sections.title: Note 1 - Insurance
sections.content: Insurance certificate indicates coverage term May 18, 2025 to May 18, 2026 and property amount of $115,930,000. Deductibles include $25,000 standard, $50,000 sewer backup, $50,000 water, $100,000 flood, and $100,000 earthquake. Unit owner should maintain contents, betterments/improvements, liability, and deductible chargeback protection.

sections.title: Note 2 - Budget and Reserve Fund
sections.content: Reserve fund balance is $1,770,174.69 (unaudited) as of Jun 30, 2025. Most recent reserve fund study is Class 3 dated Feb 2025. Board issued reserve plan notice on Apr 4, 2025 and implemented plan. Corporation discloses no known increase circumstances except seen/unforeseen costs that could lead to special assessment, loan, or increased common expenses as reflected in minutes.

sections.title: Note 3 - Pet Rules
sections.content: Pet owners must immediately clean pet waste from common elements. Failure can constitute nuisance and may result in mandatory permanent pet removal after notice.

sections.title: Note 4 - Tenancy / Leasing Rules
sections.content: Before tenant occupancy, owner must provide tenant info form, tenant undertaking/acknowledgment, and lease/application documents. Non-compliance can result in occupants being treated as trespassers until compliance. Owner must notify corporation within 7 days after tenancy ends; tenant subletting is prohibited; owner remains responsible for tenant-caused common-element damage; owner loses common-element use during tenant occupancy. Approximately 219 units reported leased.

sections.title: Note 5 - Use Restrictions
sections.content: No barbecues indoors or on balconies. Smoking prohibited in common areas except board-designated smoking area. Awnings/foil/shades on windows, patios, balconies or terraces require board consent. Hanging or drying clothes on balconies/exclusive use areas is prohibited.

sections.title: Note 6 - Legal Proceedings
sections.content: Multiple proceedings are disclosed, primarily tied to 2021/2022 flood and riser/mechanical contractor issues, including claims where corporation is plaintiff and claims/third-party or defendant claims against corporation. Disclosed claim values include $951,704 quantified damages in one action, $156,472 in counterclaim action, $2,000,000 corporation claim, and multiple owner/tenant claims in $35,000 to $200,000 ranges.

sections.title: Note 7 - Prior Special Assessments
sections.content: Status certificate says no assessment levied since current budget date. Financial statements disclose prior-year board-approved special assessment of $3,470,466 (twelve monthly installments beginning June 2023) and an additional $262,795 transfer from general fund to reserve fund due to higher riser retrofit costs.

sections.title: Note 8 - Underground Garage Repairs
sections.content: Corporation states underground garage repairs are planned on all levels, to be paid from reserve fund; cost not known at certificate date.
